title: key
description: `Key` objects describe key-value pairs in each entry.

type.description: the data type for the corresponding stored value.

unique.description: If an attribute is `unique`, then any other instance with the same value refers to the same object (i.e. is a duplicate).

distinguishing.description: If an attribute is `distinguishing`, then if its value is different from another instance, they are not the same objects (i.e. not a duplicate).

format.description: Whether additional checks should be preformed on the stored value.  If `numeric`, then the stored value must either be a number (integer or float), or a string which is convertible to a number (e.g. '1.234', '42', '3.14e15').  If `astrotime` ...
